title: [bugfix] Read Tipsy Aux files correctly

content.raw: We can come back to making this more efficient in the worse case later, better to make the code functional than nothing.
content.html: We can come back to making this more efficient in the worse case later, better to make the code functional than nothing.

content.raw: Agreed. Premature optimization is the root of all evil.
content.html: Agreed. Premature optimization is the root of all evil.

content.raw: All tests pass. Good job!
content.html: All tests pass. Good job!

content.raw:
I still get errors when trying to ready aux tipsy files.
I get a ton of error messages like this one
"Line #1463338 (got 3 columns instead of 2)"

What do you think it means?
content.html:
I still get errors when trying to ready aux tipsy files. I get a ton of error messages like this one "Line #1463338 (got 3 columns instead of 2)"

content.raw: I think it means I missed an edge case.  I'm going to re-write this, and do it right the first time, since this lazy hack is clearly insufficient.
content.html: I think it means I missed an edge case. I'm going to re-write this, and do it right the first time, since this lazy hack is clearly insufficient.

content.raw: I just pushed a re-write, this is (I think) the cleanest and most robust way to do this.  Can you try it now?  Thanks!
content.html: I just pushed a re-write, this is (I think) the cleanest and most robust way to do this. Can you try it now? Thanks!

content.raw: How do I get the updated file?
content.html: How do I get the updated file?

content.raw: You can just do an 'hg pull && hg update'.  Alternatively, you could send me the files that've been causing the issues (param file, output, aux file) and I can test it.
content.html: You can just do an 'hg pull && hg update'. Alternatively, you could send me the files that've been causing the issues (param file, output, aux file) and I can test it.

content.raw:
Mmmm...
I did 
hg pull && hg update

but I still get the same error message, maybe I didn't get the updated file.
content.html:
Mmmm... I did hg pull && hg update

but I still get the same error message, maybe I didn't get the updated file.

content.raw:
You need to first navigate to the root of the yt mercurial repository, then do:

```
hg pull -r 99a80fa https://bitbucket.org/bwkeller/yt
hg update 99a80fa
python setup.py develop
```

And you should have the version with the patch installed.
content.html:
You need to first navigate to the root of the yt mercurial repository, then do:

hg pull -r 99a80fa https://bitbucket.org/bwkeller/yt
hg update 99a80fa
python setup.py develop

And you should have the version with the patch installed.

content.raw:
I get a few error messages if I do this.
If I re-install the stable version of yT from scratch will I get the updated routine for the tipsy routine?
content.html: I get a few error messages if I do this. If I re-install the stable version of yT from scratch will I get the updated routine for the tipsy routine?

content.raw:
What error messages are you seeing? It's best to share the whole error message using a pastebin service. We have paste.yt-project.org set up for this purpose.

You won't get this bugfix on the stable branch until it gets merged and we backport it to stable.
content.html:
What error messages are you seeing? It's best to share the whole error message using a pastebin service. We have paste.yt-project.org set up for this purpose.

content.raw: All tests pass. Good job!
content.html: All tests pass. Good job!

content.raw:
Yes, it's best to be on a version controlled version of yt. How did you install yt originally?

If you don't want to go through all these steps to get the bugfix and are comfortable with sharing your data for testing, that might be an easier route to confirm that the bugfix is correct. That way Ben will be able to develop using your real data.

Failing that, you could wait until we issue a new stable release, probably within the next week or two.
content.html:
Yes, it's best to be on a version controlled version of yt. How did you install yt originally?

If you don't want to go through all these steps to get the bugfix and are comfortable with sharing your data for testing, that might be an easier route to confirm that the bugfix is correct. That way Ben will be able to develop using your real data.

Failing that, you could wait until we issue a new stable release, probably within the next week or two.

content.raw:
I really appreciate all your help, but I need to ask my collaborators if it's ok to share my tipsy files.
But, also, if I download the file down here would that be the most updated version or only yesterday's fix?
content.html: I really appreciate all your help, but I need to ask my collaborators if it's ok to share my tipsy files. But, also, if I download the file down here would that be the most updated version or only yesterday's fix?

content.raw:
It depends on where you are getting it from. I'd strongly urge you to use yt's version control system for this.

Alternately, you could share some test data that exhibits the same error.

How did you install yt initially? It should be possible to install yt in your home folder without root permissions so you can test Ben's patch for yourself.
content.html:
It depends on where you are getting it from. I'd strongly urge you to use yt's version control system for this.

Alternately, you could share some test data that exhibits the same error.

How did you install yt initially? It should be possible to install yt in your home folder without root permissions so you can test Ben's patch for yourself.

content.raw:
I'm asking my collaborators what I can share and get back to you.
As you for sh install_script.sh"
content.html: I'm asking my collaborators what I can share and get back to you. As you for sh install_script.sh"

content.raw:
In that case you should be able to install cython with

"pip install -U cython"

make sure you're in the yt environment.  You should then be able to set up yt with "python setup.py develop" in the root of the yt mercurial repository.
content.html:
In that case you should be able to install cython with

"pip install -U cython"

make sure you're in the yt environment. You should then be able to set up yt with "python setup.py develop" in the root of the yt mercurial repository.

content.raw:
I was able to install cython and get Ben's update, but I still get this error

Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module> File "/home/mtomas/yt-x86_64/src/yt-hg/yt/data_objects/data_containers.py", line 253, in getitem self.get_data(f) File "/home/mtomas/yt-x86_64/src/yt-hg/yt/data_objects/data_containers.py", line 745, in get_data particles, self, self._current_chunk) File "/home/mtomas/yt-x86_64/src/yt-hg/yt/geometry/geometry_handler.py", line 227, in _read_particle_fields fields_to_read) File "/home/mtomas/yt-x86_64/src/yt-hg/yt/utilities/io_handler.py", line 187, in _read_particle_selection rv[field_f][my_ind:my_ind + vals.shape[0],...] = vals ValueError: could not broadcast input array from shape (8649900) into shape (0)

I talked to my collaborators, and they agreed on sharing one test snapshot with you. How can I send it to Ben? The snapshot is about 2GB and the auxiliary file 200 MB.
content.html:
I was able to install cython and get Ben's update, but I still get this error

Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module> File "/home/mtomas/yt-x86_64/src/yt-hg/yt/data_objects/data_containers.py", line 253, in getitem self.get_data(f) File "/home/mtomas/yt-x86_64/src/yt-hg/yt/data_objects/data_containers.py", line 745, in get_data particles, self, self._current_chunk) File "/home/mtomas/yt-x86_64/src/yt-hg/yt/geometry/geometry_handler.py", line 227, in _read_particle_fields fields_to_read) File "/home/mtomas/yt-x86_64/src/yt-hg/yt/utilities/io_handler.py", line 187, in _read_particle_selection rv[field_f][my_ind:my_ind + vals.shape[0],...] = vals ValueError: could not broadcast input array from shape (8649900) into shape (0)

I talked to my collaborators, and they agreed on sharing one test snapshot with you. How can I send it to Ben? The snapshot is about 2GB and the auxiliary file 200 MB.

content.raw: Do you have an http server you can put it on?  Or alternatively, if you have a big enough Dropbox account, you could send it to me that way.
content.html: Do you have an http server you can put it on? Or alternatively, if you have a big enough Dropbox account, you could send it to me that way.

content.raw:
Dropbox or google drive links should work. You can also use the curldrop service we've recently set up.

At the command line, do

```
curl -T yourfile http://use.yt/upload/
```

And then send Ben the link that should print out once it finishes uploading.
content.html:
Dropbox or google drive links should work. You can also use the curldrop service we've recently set up.

At the command line, do

curl -T yourfile http://use.yt/upload/

And then send Ben the link that should print out once it finishes uploading.

content.raw: I have my file on google drive. Ben, please share your email address with me.
content.html: I have my file on google drive. Ben, please share your email address with me.

content.raw: I've just tested the files you sent me, they load properly with this PR.  I'm not sure where that final error came from (I can't reproduce it), but I'm pretty confident this PR has fixed the problem.
content.html: I've just tested the files you sent me, they load properly with this PR. I'm not sure where that final error came from (I can't reproduce it), but I'm pretty confident this PR has fixed the problem.

content.raw: @mtomas one way to check that you're on the PR is if the output of the `yt version` command on the command line prints out the commit hash for the tip of this pull request (99a80fa). You might need to `pip install python-hglib` first to get `yt version` to be able to extract version information from your installation.
content.html: mtomas one way to check that you're on the PR is if the output of the yt version command on the command line prints out the commit hash for the tip of this pull request (99a80fa). You might need to pip install python-hglib first to get yt version to be able to extract version information from your installation.

description: The method for reading tipsy auxiliary files was horrendously broken, essentially only aux files in ascii format would read correctly. The new method is greatly simplified, and as an added bonus actually works.
